snippet: Hundreds of thousands of foreign workers in Saudi Arabia are trying to rectify their immigration status by July 3, when the government will resume a crackdown on illegal labor.
abstract: Indonesian workers frustrated by long waits to get exit visas from Saudi Arabia protest outside their consulate in Jeddah, setting fire to building’s outer wall and briefly clashing with security forces; hundreds of thousands of workers are trying to rectify their immigration status or leave before July, when Saudi government will resume crackdown on illegal labor.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands of foreign workers in Saudi Arabia are trying to rectify their immigration status by July 3, when the government will resume a crackdown on illegal labor.

headline.main: Indonesians Irked by Delay With Saudis
headline.print_headline: Indonesians Irked by Delay With Saudis
